text: Dominique Dord (born September 1, 1959 in Chambéry, Savoie) is a French politician of the French Republican Party who served as a member of the National Assembly of France between 1997 and 2017. He represented the Savoie department, He is also the mayor of Aix-les-Bains since 2001. In the Republicans’ 2016 presidential primaries, Dort endorsed François Fillon as the party’s candidate for the office of President of France.Ludovic Vigogne (April 20, 2016), Bataillons: Primaire à droite: la liste des premiers soutiens parlementaires L'Opinion. ==References== Category:1959 births Category:Living people Category:People from Chambéry Category:Republican Party (France) politicians Category:Liberal Democracy (France) politicians Category:The Republicans (France) politicians Category:Mayors of places in Auvergne-Rhône- Alpes Category:Deputies of the 12th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:Deputies of the 13th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:Deputies of the 14th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:HEC Paris alumni
title: Dominique Dord
